body:
It only happen on the local app not on the built app, strange ... so i have this issue only if i run the app from the terminal while building and installing it the DOM highlighter WORKS ðŸ˜†  

... no ideas unfortunately i don't even knew if to submit the issue or not because it could be anything actually ...

I have the same Problem. Just updated electron again and noticed that its still not solved. So im happy to see the issue is tracked now. Can't work without inspector running so i always switch back to previous electron version for developing and hope this will be fixed soon.

@TIM0N Do you experience this problem also when you install your electron app? Because when i build and install it everything seems to work... weird..

I also tried hard googling for the error code but nothing comes up and the inspector file is bundled and quite impossible to debug, i have no ideas for the moment :/
Yes it's  like you described. It's working after i build it.  But running from command line with v1.6.2 throws this error.
Have the same issue here. Developing on linux and OSX and this happens only on OSX for me. So might be something platform specific

Just a heads up. Updated to 1.6.3.
Issue is still present. No change

Hi! Have the same issue.

- macOS sierra
- electron 1.6.3
- node 7.7.2 
- npm 4.1.2

When I run `electron .` in terminal and then I am trying to inspect some elements always receive error as below: 

`[38951:0314/143735.852491:ERROR:CONSOLE(3203)] "Protocol Error: the message without method: {"error":{"code":-32700,"message":"Message must be a valid JSON"}}", source: chrome-devtools://devtools/bundled/inspector.js (3203)`

Got the same issue.

 - macOS Sierra
 - electron 1.6.2
 - node 7.6.0
 - npm 4.1.2

The basic setup is based on `electron-react-boilerplate`, I'm not 100% sure whether the issue appeared after an `yarn upgrade electron` or just started happening.

Same error:
`[34466:0316/121026.995527:ERROR:CONSOLE(3203)] "Protocol Error: the message without method: {"error":{"code":-32700,"message":"Message must be a valid JSON"}}", source: chrome-devtools://devtools/bundled/inspector.js (3203)`

> If still unable to reproduce it, just clone https://github.com/720kb/ndm.git and run npm i && npm run mac on MacOS. Then just go to open devtools from the OS menu.

I tried this and it appeared to work for me, am I missing something? Here is a screencap:

![dom-highlight](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/671378/24018354/ced33e04-0a50-11e7-8a3f-c942cd45ac90.gif)

@kevinsawicki so weird ðŸ˜„ 
I really don't know what is causing this but also re-cloning the repo doesn't fix it for me unfortunately. 

I will try on a clean VM and let you know, do you know if the npm version could be involved in any way? I will try maybe with some different setups i really have no idea what this could depend on, i am sorry for that.

https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7761650/24019558/ca79a648-0a98-11e7-90fc-b232a8db8719.gif

> I will try on a clean VM and let you know, do you know if the npm version could be involved in any way?

I don't think it is.
@45kb do you have any dev tools extensions installed in Electron?
none @kevinsawicki but if you know how to check this for sure i do, i never installed anything really...

> but if you know how to check this for sure i do, i never installed anything really...

From the dev tools console:

```js
Object.keys(require('electron').remote.BrowserWindow.getDevToolsExtensions())
```

Got exactly the same behaviour starting _after_ electron 1.4.15.

Notice the element selection is blocked in DevTools because an error is raised about an incorrectly formatted JSON message somewhere. Although, `yarn` (an `npm` clone) reports an inconsistent version constraint on package `ajv`, which is actually a JSON validator...

```
$ yarn install
...
warning "ajv-keywords@2.0.1-beta.1" has incorrect peer dependency "ajv@>=5.0.3-beta.0".
...
$ yarn why acv-keywords
...
info This module exists because "webpack" depends on it.
...
$ yarn list ajv
...
â”œâ”€ ajv@4.11.5
...
â””â”€ electron-builder@15.5.1
â”‚  â””â”€ ajv@5.0.4-beta.0
...
$ yarn why ajv
...
info Has been hoisted to "ajv"
info Reasons this module exists
   - "webpack" depends on it
   - "electron#electron-download#nugget#request#har-validator" depends on it
...
```

I have the same problem on Mac OS X with electron 1.4.15 and electron 1.6.4 . Strange thing is that it just appeared one day without reason. I tried to update electron to latest version (1.6.4) but nothing changed. Maybe a Mac OS X update that changed something ?

Current Mac OS X version: 10.12.3 (don't know which one it was last time I observed the devtools working correctly, my mac just autoupdates)

Same Issue on

- OSX Sierra ( Windows working perfectly ) 
- Since Electron Version 1.4.5 ( Still not working on 1.6.4 )

After packaging the App, everything works perfectly.

+1

OS: OSX Sierra 10.12.3
Electron Version: 1.6.4 (1.4.13 works, dunno about versions in between)
I noticed that if i switch my OSX system language from Italian to English the problem goes away. Maybe it's a problem with non-english versions? I'm on OSX Sierra 10.12.4, Electron 1.6.2
@kevinsawicki i really think @loramt is right, i also switched the OS default language from ita to english and now it works perfectly.
Same for me. With macOS Sierra in French it doesn't work. If I switch to english it works fine !

I'll try this asap, I dont have my machine at hand right now, but system
language is german, so thats probably it.

Am 01.04.2017 8:53 nachm. schrieb "popod" <notifications@github.com>:

> Same for me. With macOS Sierra in French it doesn't work. If I switch to
> english it works fine !
>
> â€”
> You are receiving this because you commented.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/8876#issuecomment-290939751>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAcReRew8ak1tLjR24Yp60-_HCYJ3sg9ks5rrp0dgaJpZM4MX24U>
> .
>
I'm usually using French for my system. I tried to switch to English but the problem still occurs (didn't tried to restart the system, tough)
Latest nwjs â€” same error and behaviour .

Tried it, setting System language to Englisch (UK/US, doesn't matter) fixes it.

Note: You've to restart your shell/Terminal to make it work.
Yes, by restarting Terminal it works fine. Thanks for the workaround.

@MaThGo My system language was already on English, but Region was on `French - Canada`. Switching it to `United States` solved the issue. The problem seems to be tied to your locale settings... Thanks!
Thanks for the workaround. Even if i'd like to see that fixed soon ðŸ˜„

Hi everyone, I figured out another, possibly better workaround. I have the same problem on OS X (with Czech language and Czech Republic region) with Electron 1.6.5. Changing the locale to English fixes it. **But if you don't want to change the system locale, you can do this:** If you use Apple Terminal, in Preferences -> Profiles, on Advanced tab of your default profile, in International section (at the bottom), there is an option called _Set locale environment variables on startup_. **Uncheck the option and restart the terminal.** Here is a screenshot of setting the option (in Czech locale): Hope it helps.
@pokusew worked for me! Thanks a lot. It is 'Set the local environment variable at startup' in english.
Even simpler workaround: simply prefix your command with "LANG=en_US.UTF-8"
I could reproduce this in standalone chrome when using a `LANG` value of `de_DE.UTF-8`, reported upstream at https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=715313
This has been fixed upstream via https://codereview.chromium.org/2843223005/
This will be fixed in the next Electron release, 1.7.2
